GapFillInput.Title: Infinitives and -ing forms after adjectives
GapFillInput.Instruction: Fill each gap with an adjective and a verb from the word pool in the infinitive or -ing form.

Content.Question:
1. I’m sorry to sound rude, but please could you switch your MP3 player down; it’s very loud.
2. This unfortunate situation is unlikely to improve in the next 24 hours.
3. It was so easy to understand the verb patterns when our teacher explained them in class.
4. Kim’s busy running round after the children at the moment!
5. Jackie is not good at giving presentations, she prefers to write them!
6. Do you really want the job? If you do, just sell your house and move to London, it’s a
risk worth taking.
7. It’s so good to be back at home after three weeks in hospital.
8. Tina and Bill were anxious to sell their house as soon as possible, so they could move
abroad.
9. William was afraid to swim on his own, so his teacher supported him while he splashed!
10. I’m so anxious about looking good for this first date tonight that I can’t concentrate on work today.
